circumstances:
The airplane departed RAF Scampton on a mine laying operation off Lorient. While taking off at night, it crashed into a Nissen hut located near one of the dispersal pans, bursting into flames. All four crew members escaped with minor injuries while three people in the Nissen hut were killed, a fourth was seriously injured. 
Crew:
Sgt A. J. Garwell,
Sgt Kirke, 
Sgt R. J. Flux,
Sgt White.
Those killed on ground were:
AC1 Ronald King,
AC2 William Fraser,
AC2 Robert Rennie.
